intro: Psychotria caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in the Caribbean islands and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests and understorey habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
